intro: Relbunium buxifolium, commonly known as the boxleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial with distinctive, glossy, boxwood-like leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue-violet flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Relbunium buxifolium is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
